name: BuildQualityChecks
description: Breaks a build based on quality metrics like number of warnings or code coverage.
author: Microsoft Premier Services

inputs.name: warningFailOption
inputs.label: Fail Build On
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail build either if it exceeds a fixed number of warnings or the previous build's warning count.

inputs.name: warningThreshold
inputs.label: Warning Threshold
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the maximum number of warnings. The build will fail if this number is exceeded.

inputs.name: forceFewerWarnings
inputs.label: Force Fewer Warnings
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, the build will fail if the number of warnings has not decreased since the last build.

inputs.name: warningTaskFilters
inputs.label: Task Filters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Regular expressions (one per line) to include relevant warnings. Note: Use JavaScript RegExp syntax. [More information](http://www.regular-expressions.info/javascript.html)

inputs.name: checkCoverage
inputs.label: Enabled
inputs.helpMarkDown: Activate to check code coverage (currently based on covered blocks).

inputs.name: coverageFailOption
inputs.label: Fail Build On
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail build if its code coverage value falls below a fixed value or the previous build's code coverage value.

inputs.name: coverageThreshold
inputs.label: Code Coverage Threshold
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the minimum code coverage value in percentage terms.

inputs.name: forceCoverageImprovement
inputs.label: Force Coverage Improvement
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, the build will fail if code coverage value has not improved since the last build.

inputs.name: coverageUpperThreshold
inputs.label: Upper Threshold
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the upper threshold for code coverage improvements. [More information](https://github.com/almtcger/VstsExtensions/blob/master/BuildQualityChecks/en-US/overview.md#parameters-of-the-code-coverage-policy)
inputs.visibleRule: checkCoverage = true && coverageFailOption = build && forceCoverageImprovement = true

inputs.name: coverageDeltaType
inputs.label: Delta Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use percentage value or absolute value when comparing code coverage.
inputs.visibleRule: checkCoverage = true && coverageFailOption = build && forceCoverageImprovement = false

inputs.name: coverageModuleFilters
inputs.label: Module Filters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Regular expressions (one per line) to include relevant modules. Note: Use JavaScript RegExp syntax. [More information](http://www.regular-expressions.info/javascript.html)

messages.NoOAuthAccess: Unable to get OAuth token. Please ensure that tasks are allowed to access the OAuth token used by the build (see build options)!
messages.NoPolicyEnabled: No build quality policies have been enabled.
messages.PrevBuildWarningsExceeded: The number of warnings (%d) has increased since the previous build! The previous build had %d warning(s).
messages.NotFewerWarnings: The number of warnings (%d) has not decreased since the previous build! The previous build had %d warning(s).
messages.WarningThresholdExceeded: The number of warnings (%d) exceeds threshold (%d)!
messages.NoMatchingTaskFilter: The specified task filters did not match any build task.
messages.InvalidRegEx: The expression '%s' is not a valid regular expression and will be ignored.
messages.BelowCoverageThreshold: The code coverage value (%d%%) is lower than the minimum value (%d%%)!
messages.BelowPrevBuildCoverage: The code coverage value (%d%%, %d blocks) is lower than the value of the previous build! The previous build had a coverage value of %d%% (%d blocks).
messages.NoCoverageImprovement: The code coverage value (%d%%) has not improved since the last build! The previous build had a coverage value of %d%%.
messages.NoModulesMatched: The specified module filters did not match any code coverage modules.
messages.CoveragePassed: Code coverage policy passed with %d%% (%d blocks).
messages.TaskFailed: At least one build quality policy was violated. See Build Quality Checks section for more details.
